H0.text: A muscle cell provides genetic information from the father to a puppy that inherits traits from both the mother and the father.

H1.text: A nerve cell provides genetic information from the father to the puppy, contributing to the puppy's inherited traits from both parents.

H2.text: A blood cell is the structure that provides genetic information from the father to the puppy, contributing to the puppy’s traits inherited from both parents.

H3.text: A sperm cell provides genetic information from the father to the puppy, contributing to the puppy’s traits along with those inherited from the mother.

A4.text: The spermatozoon provides the haploid paternal genome to the oocyte.

A5.text: The nuclear DNA in sperm cells is haploid, that is, they contribute only one copy of each paternal chromosome pair.
